ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 52
ygData.msgSnippet: Ahh bad ... err ... fond memories of UO.  This, thank God, has never happened to me in EQ, but it consistently Happened to me in UO.  It was just so
ygData.messageBody:
Ahh bad ... err ... fond memories of UO. This, thank God, has never
happened to me in EQ, but it consistently Happened to me in UO. It was just
so frustrating thinking O.K. off to bed .. bam die .. 20 minutes to get to
my corpse.
etc etc etc

Maline D'Assault
> "Klotzen, nicht Kleckern"
>
> ----------
> From: Morix@...[SMTP:Morix@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Monday, June 07, 1999 6:39 PM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Digest Number 52
>
> From: Morix@...
>
> In a message dated 6/7/99 1:21:56 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
> warriors_eq@onelist.com writes:
>
> > I dont know why, but I NEVER goto bed without my body (its to hard
> > to sleep :)
> >
> > I think maybe its a UO thing, whenever I die in EQ I make a B'line
> > back to my body ASAP.
>
> I do exactly the same thing, and I know why. Because I don't want to take
>
> the chance of going to bed and waking up tomorrow to find my body has
> vanished because such and such time limit has expired. It's kind of a
> bugaboo as well, because sometimes when I'm really tired I think, Okay
> just
> one more monster and I'm off to sleep. Then that monster ends up killing
> me
> and I have to spend all this time running back to my body.
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------

> http://www.onelist.com
> Deadline is June 19. Join now to win $5000 for your charity of choice.
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> For the Honor and Glory of the Warlord, Rallos Zek!
>
